<|endoftext|>Congress should not use the Second Circuit to nullify any measure that attempts to implement meaningful and long-term reform of the Federal securities laws. This is the way to balance the Federal Government's role in the regulatory environment. <|endoftext|>Senator Akaka noted the bill already has provisions in the committee bill to establish regulations that would require amendments to apply in the same way to amendments in legislation. He further explained that the amendment process is affected by the Securities and Exchange Commission's release schedule.  The SEC's release schedule forces investors to wait a long time before they can withdraw their money and also imposes time limits on submission of necessary safety disclosures. We worked with the SEC and the Department of the Treasury in this area to work out a compromise with the intent of clarifying that existing rules will apply to stock issues similar to amendments in legislation.
